the election got bogged down in all

once the results were posted they've

basically left a gridlock and rather

Syria Turkey had a vested interest in
its outcome for Iran the main thing was
to reunite a Shia coalition that would
rule the country after years of Sunni

Saudi Arabia Syria Turkey wanted to see
the inclusion of Sunnis they didn't want

Church's sexual abuse scandal continues

crimes I also knowledge with you a shame
I'm Laurie Goodstein national religion
correspondent for the New York Times the
sexual abuse scandal in the Roman
Catholic Church in the United States
peaked in 2002 but 2010 was the year
that the scandal spread across Europe
engulfed the Vatican and touched on the
records of two popes Pope John Paul the
second and Pope Benedict the 16th
thousands of cases of people who said
they had been abused by priests as
children emerged in Germany in
Switzerland in the Netherlands and
Belgium and in Ireland for years Vatican
officials had said the sexual abuse
scandal was an American problem or a
problem in english-speaking countries
but now the scandal was right at their
own door the case that got the most
attention in Europe this year was a case
in Germany that involved the Pope
himself when he was Archbishop of Munich
in 1980 priest named father Peter
Hillerman who had a record of pedophilia
and was being treated for pedophilia was
reassigned to work in a parish and he
was still working there this year until
his record was discovered the church
said that Archbishop Ratzinger was not
responsible for the assignment but the
New York Times found records showing
that he had attended a meeting where the
reassignment was discussed and was
copied on a memo the vatican tried to
address the abuse crisis by releasing
changes to its canon laws that would
make it easier for bishops and quicker
for them to discipline priest accused of
abuse but what should have been seen as
a positive step forward for them
backfired when they release the changes
and canon law they included on a list of
grave offenses not only sexual abuse of
children but also the ordination of
women as priests and the reaction to
that across the board was quite negative
these cases aren't going away for the
church victims in Latin America in Asia
are beginning to step forward sexual
abuse is still a terrible taboo in many
cultures but as victims realized that
they weren't the only ones they begin to
have the courage to step forward to
which is why this whole story isn't
going away join us again tomorrow for x
